reviews.text: We wanted a decent hotel near Legoland, but not too far from San Diego Zoo. We (my wife and 2 young daughters) like Hampton Inns because they usually provide good value for the money. The Hampton Inn San Marcos lived up to our expectations. Room was clean and comfortable. Staff pleasant and accomodating. Free breakfast typical of the chain (better than most other hotels but not as good as Embassy Suites). We had planned for two nights, and wanted to stay an extra day at the last minute. A quick call to the front desk from the Legoland parking lot made it easy. Location is 10 minutes from Legoland, and 30 minutes to San Diego Zoo. We would stay here again, if we wanted a hotel convenient for both northern and southern San Diego attractions.
reviews.title: Good hotel for Legoland and San Diego Zoo

likes.liked: — bedding and pillows, very clean bathroom

reviews.text: Stayed 2 nights late June, 2007. It's a pretty decent Hampton Inn - decent breakfast, nice bed & pillows, and best of all, free FAST wireless Internet. It's a bit of drive to San Diego attractions (around 1/2 hour), but not too bad.
reviews.title: Nice place to sleep

reviews.text: while this Hampton Inn is nice, it is certainly not the best and cleanest Hampton I've come across.
reviews.title: Hampton on the highway

reviews.text: Location: about 2 miles up from the San Marcos Prime Outlet (if you're driving southbound on I35, make sure you take exit 200 and go around the underpass -- the hotel is located along the frontage road behind a Chili's and Luby's cafeteria).
reviews.title: SuperCleanSuperFriendly
Very Nice Hotel, exceeded expectations
reviews.text: cleanliness: one of the previous reviews mentioned about the hotel carpet, and I must agree it was pretty dirty looking -- almost looks like it's been flooded before and the stains just remained. There is a strong deodorized scent throughout the room corridors, but overall the cleanliness issue amounts to what looks more like war-wounds from probably some wild Texas State post-game party.
Always prefer trying independent hotels when I can. But in the height of summer with a few days to book, this isn't going to happen at an affordable price.
reviews.title: Decent. (Works for Legoland)

reviews.text: Needed somewhere close to Legoland. This place works, only about 15 mins away.
reviews.title: I had a great stay.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Staff were great and helpful. Allowed use of pool after hours etc...
reviews.title: Not too shabby

reviews.text: Room and breakfast were of usual Hampton Inn high standards. Comfortable beds. HDTV. Wifi worked well with no dropouts. Clean.
reviews.title: Quiet and clean

reviews.text: NOTE-
reviews.title: Good for Hilton Honors free night

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: In my opinion, this hotel is tops. The bed was especially comfortable, and I really appreciated the nice linens. The breakfast area was kept spotlessly clean, well attended, and the woman who does this deserves accolades. They even offer brown bag breakfast to go for those who have no time to linger in the dining area. My one tiny criticism is that the hot breakfast food that is offered, such as scrambled eggs, is not very tasty, since it appears to be a product that is quickly and easily prepared with minimal kitchen facilities and staff. However, there is such a wide variety of other breakfast food, that this hardly matters except for those people who like a traditional breakfast of eggs and meat. We requested a room that was located as far from the freeway noise as possible, and it was waiting for us at check-in. Don't hesitate to book a room at this hote.
reviews.title: Very pleased

reviews.text: The Hampton Inn was a pleasant surprise. Our house was being tented for termites and we needed somewhere local to stay. The day we were set to arrive it was 103 degrees and my youngest child had the flu. It was 9 a.m. but the friendly staff let us have breakfast and check in early so she could sleep. With nowhere else to go this was a godsend. They sent up a mini-fridge so we could chill water for her.
reviews.title: Great Hotel in North County San Diego

likes.liked: — Clean hotel with comfy beds and friendly staff

reviews.text: We stayed for several days and were pleased with the comfort of the rooms and those comfy beds with the luxurious bedding. My kids liked doing homework on the lap desks. Breakfast was filling and had a variety of choices. Fresh cookies are available in the evening and a computer with internet access is in the lobby for guest use.
reviews.title: Standard Hampton Inn Quality & Breakfast

reviews.text: The hotel is clean and quiet. The pool is small but tidy.
reviews.title: Sweet Stay at the Hampton

reviews.text: We stayed one night on our way north from San Diego. We have always had good luck with Hamptons and this one did not disappoint. It was clean and the breakfast was normal Hampton fare. The bathroom door did not stay open, I believe it was mentioned in an earlier post, which kept the bathroom a little steamy after showers. We just put a bag in front of it to keep it open.
reviews.title: best place in the area
Great Hotel!!!
reviews.text: Beautiful hotel. New -- or at least seems like it. Great location. Nice staff. FANTASTIC breakfast!!!! Extremely comfortable beds! Very comfortable, clean, safe. Great value! I would definetely stay here again. No problems what so ever!

We were very impressed with this place during our four night stay in August. The service was wonderful and the entire place, inside and out, is in great shape and lovingly cared for. The pool was clean, roomy, and usually empty, the breakfast offered a pleasant variety, and there's lots of ample parking. We'll stay here if ever back in the area.
reviews.title: Nice place with good service!

reviews.text: I stayed at the Hampton Inn, San Marcos, for one night on 3/17/05 with three teenagers. We found the room to be quite adequate. There were lots of channels on the cable tv, the room was clean but there was a little highway noise. When I checked in (about 6 p.m.) they had freshly baked chocolate chip cookies at the front dessk....a nice way to start the stay! The free breakfast was very nice....although the eggs were a bit rubbery, they did have cream gravy and biscuits, along with the normal bagels, danishes, toast, cereal, fresh fruit and yogurt. The beds were quite hard but that is not necessarily a bad thing. Not the best Hampton Inn I've ever stayed in but certainly not bad at all. I would stay here again.
reviews.title: Good place to stay
Great place to stay
reviews.text: San Marcos Hampton Inn is a great place to stay if you just need a place to crash for the night. It doesn't have any fancy immenities in the rooms. However they are clean and well maintained. The sheets and comforters are boiled after each visitor (I've seen the laundry room for myself on a pillow mission) and they have the nice soft kind of underblanket, and not the scratchy, pubic hair attracting ones that we all fear. Staff is always on duty, and there are no hidden fees in your stay. Just a note, they authorize $150 dollars when you first check in on your credit card, no matter what the rate is, and then release it upon check out. Your best bet is not to use your Visa check card because of this issue. (unless you have some money to let go of for the week).

reviews.title: Excellent hotel
reviews.text: We stayed only one night in the Hampton Inn in San Marcos, CA but it was completey enjoyable. The rooms were very clean and comfortable, the continental breakfast was very complete and very enjoyable. The staff was very knowledgeabel and helpful. All in all it was a most pleasant experience.
